key_points: Colonial Pipeline experienced a temporary network disruption but has resolved it.
This disruption was not related to malware, according to the company.
The issue was with the company's shipping nomination system, affecting shippers' ability to enter and update delivery nominations.
Colonial Pipeline's network functionality has returned to normal.
The cause of the network issues was not specified.
The shipping nomination system is operated by Transport4 (T4), a third-party company.
T4 reported that its application was functioning normally for all customers and carriers.
This incident follows a recent ransomware attack that significantly disrupted fuel delivery in the southeast U.S.
About 6,000 gas stations in the southeast were still without fuel as a result of the earlier disruption.
Gasoline prices have risen to the highest in seven years, partly due to the hack and the onset of the Memorial Day weekend.
